io.spine.util

Class Exceptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.util.Exceptions

  • public final class Exceptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for working with exceptions for cases that are not covered by Throwables class from Guava.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • unsupported

        public static java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException unsupported(java.lang.String message)
        Always throws UnsupportedOperationException initialized with the passed string.

        Use this method in combination with static import for brevity of code for unsupported operations. The return type is given to keep Java type system happy when called in methods with return type as shown below: 

          
   import static io.spine.util.Exceptions.unsupported;
   ...
   T doSomething() {
      throw unsupported("Cannot do this");
   }
        Parameters:
        message - the message for exception
        Returns:
        nothing ever
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - always

      • unsupported

        public static java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException unsupported(java.lang.String format,
                                                                  java.lang.Object... args)
        Always throws UnsupportedOperationException initialized with the formatted string.

        Use this method in combination with static import for brevity of code for unsupported operations. The return type is given to keep Java type system happy when called in methods with return type as shown below: 

          

   import static io.spine.util.Exceptions.unsupported;
   ...
   T doSomething() {
      throw unsupported("This operation is not supported because of %s and %s", arg1, arg2);
   }
        Parameters:
        format - the format string
        args - formatting parameters
        Returns:
        nothing ever
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - always

      • unsupported

        public static java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException unsupported()
        Always throws UnsupportedOperationException.

        Use this method in combination with static import for brevity of code for unsupported operations. The return type is given to keep Java type system happy when called in methods with return type as shown below: 

           import static static io.spine.util.Exceptions.unsupported;
   ...
   T doSomething() {
      throw unsupported();
   }
        Returns:
        nothing ever
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - always
